creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: standing wooden figure with flame like hair, and fierce expression wearing warrior clothing; wide stance with PR hand clenched in fist toward chest; PL hand clenched in fist with index finger pointing outward; base with carved and painted waves
inscription:
Inscription

In black ink on the peg of the left foot: [Shin] (Saru) (Monkey); In black ink on the underside of the base: [Saru/Hachi] (Monkey/Eight)
medium: Wood with traces of pigment and inlaid crystal
title: Makora, one of the Twelve Divine Generals
